intro: Duguetia dilabens, commonly known as the red-flowered evergreen, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has elliptical leaves with a smooth surface and a dark green color. It produces small, black fruits that contain seeds covered in a fleshy, sticky coating. Duguetia dilabens plays an important role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat, providing food for various wildlife species.
